text: Teté (24 August 1907 - 18 June 1962) was a Brazilian football manager who coached Brazil national team for some games in 1956. He also coached Sport Club Internacional during the 1950s. == Biography == Teté was a major coach of football in Rio Grande do Sul. Became known as the "Marshal of Victories," because he was an officer of the Army Reserve. As a player, he served in the 9º Regimento. Then trained the Farroupilha (after the change of club name), Pelotas Brazil Guarany of Bagé, General Osorio Cruzeiro-RS Nacional-RS and Internacional . In Internacional, Teté did well. He coached the team from 1951 to 1957 and was four-time Gaucho (51, 52, 53 and 55). Also coached Brazil national team, became champion of the Pan American of 1956 in Mexico. == References == Category:People from Rio Grande do Sul Category:Brazilian football managers Category:1907 births Category:1962 deaths Category:Botafogo de Futebol e Regatas players Category:Grêmio Esportivo Brasil managers Category:Sport Club Internacional managers Category:Brazil national football team managers Category:Esporte Clube São José managers Category:Brazilian footballers Category:Association footballers not categorized by position
title: Teté
